Class SqlGeneratorFactory

java.lang.Object
edu.rit.g2.factory.SqlGeneratorFactory
public final class SqlGeneratorFactory extends Object
A factory class responsible for creating the appropriate SqlGenerator implementation based on a given DbmsType.

This class follows the Factory Method design pattern. Instead of directly instantiating SQL generator classes throughout the application, all generator creation is centralized in one place. This ensures consistency, reduces coupling, and makes the system easier to extend.

Supported mappings:

  • DbmsType.MYSQL  → MySqlGenerator
  • DbmsType.POSTGRES  → PostgreGenerator
  • DbmsType.ORACLE  → OracleGenerator

All SQL generators implement the same SqlGenerator interface, ensuring a common API for the rest of the application.

This is a non-instantiable utility class. All creation logic is exposed through the static of(DbmsType) method.

Since:
1.0

    of(DbmsType type)

  • Method Details

    • of

      public static SqlGenerator of(DbmsType type)
      Returns a concrete SqlGenerator implementation for the given database management system type.

      This method uses a switch expression to return the correct SQL generator. All supported DBMS types map to dedicated implementations of SqlGenerator.

      // Example usage:
SqlGenerator g1 = SqlGeneratorFactory.of(DbmsType.MYSQL);
SqlGenerator g2 = SqlGeneratorFactory.of(DbmsType.POSTGRES);
      Parameters:
      type - the selected database type (e.g., DbmsType.MYSQL); must not be null
      Returns:
      a corresponding SqlGenerator instance
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if type is null
